alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central El Paso County; Northern Hudspeth Highlands, Hueco Mountains; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso, Western Hudspeth Counties; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern Hudspeth County; Salt Basin; Southern Hudspeth Highlands; Western El Paso County (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 19 at 6:51AM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Areal flooding caused by excessive rainfall. Widespread rain totals of 1 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts. * WHERE...Portions of southern New Mexico, including Grant, Sierra, Otero, Luna, Hidalgo, and Dona Ana Counties. Portions of far west Texas, including El Paso and Hudspeth Counties. * WHEN...From Noon MDT today through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may be may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - - Moist ground from recent rains will allow for quick runoff of any additional moderate or heavy rain, resulting in flash flooding and possible flooding of area rivers. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
